description: From Middle English *forelock, *forelok, from Old English forelocc, equivalent to fore- +‎ lock.

entries.meaning: The part of a person's hairstyle which covers the forehead.
examples: Doth he not know that GOD seeth? / Assuredly. Verily, if he forbear not, we will drag him by the forelock, / the lying, sinful forelock. / And let him call his council to assistance: / we also will call the infernal guards to cast him into hell.

entries.meaning: The part of a horse's (or similar animal's) mane that lies on its forehead.
examples: […]  the gates themselves slowly parted, there appeared a large horse's head, with a plaited forelock under a decorated yoke, and slowly there rolled into the road a small cart, like those driven by horse-dealers, and higglers.

description: From Middle English forelok, equivalent to fore- +‎ lock.

entries.meaning: A wedge pushed through a hole at the end of a bolt to hold it in place.

verbs.description: forelock (third-person singular simple present forelocks, present participle forelocking, simple past and past participle forelocked)

entries.meaning: To fix in place with a forelock (wedge)
